Subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing Exception classes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=rtnH9nOHdtFXze2dvVXKmtViwJK5huEbqKnmM4Gvlsi_fCin

Another common case you'll want to test is where you use more 
type-specific constructors. For instance, a TimeException class might 
have getTime() and setTime() methods, and constructors that take a Date 
object as well as a string. These need to be tested. Furthermore, if the 
detail message is changed depending on the extra typed data you passed 
in, then getMessage(), printStackTrace() and some other dependent 
methods may need to be tested as well.

--
